DataElement.preferredName: Last Cycle Therapy Trastuzumab Administered Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the number used to represent the last course of trastuzumab therapy being given.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to last course of trastuzumab (a humanized recombinant monoclonal antibody directed against the HER2- receptor protein) therapy being administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:An event or sequence of events that constitute round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: A humanized recombinant monoclonal antibody directed against the HER2- receptor protein.  Trastuzumab binds to the extracellular domain of the growth factor protein HER2, thereby inhibiting proliferation of HER2 overexpressing tumor cells.  Binding with HER2 protein also initiates an antibody-dependent cell cytotoxicity.(NCI):Given.

Concepts.definition: A recombinant humanized monoclonal antibody directed against the human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2). After binding to HER2 on the tumor cell surface, trastuzumab induces an antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity against tumor cells that overexpress HER2. HER2 is overexpressed by many adenocarcinomas, particularly breast adenocarcinomas. (NCI04)
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
